test_cases.question: When was the Premier League founded?
How many teams started in the Premier League originally?
test_cases.expected_answer: 22 teams, later reduced to 20

test_cases.question: Who scored the dramatic title-winning goal for Manchester City in 2012?
test_cases.expected_answer: Sergio Agüero

test_cases.question: What was Arsenal's unbeaten season record?
test_cases.expected_answer: 26 wins and 12 draws in 2003-04

test_cases.question: What were Leicester City's odds to win the Premier League in 2015-16?
How many points did Manchester City get in their centurions season?
test_cases.expected_answer: 100 points in 2017-18

test_cases.question: Explain what xG (expected goals) measures
test_cases.expected_answer: Statistical metric that estimates probability of a shot becoming a goal based on factors like shot location, body part, and type of assist

test_cases.question: What does PPDA measure in football analytics?
test_cases.expected_answer: Passes Allowed Per Defensive Action - measures pressing intensity, low PPDA indicates aggressive pressing

test_cases.question: Explain the 4-3-3 formation and its advantages
test_cases.expected_answer: Formation with 4 defenders, 3 midfielders, 3 forwards. Wide forwards cut inside, full-backs overlap, allows high pressing and quick ball recovery

test_cases.question: What is a false nine in football tactics?
test_cases.expected_answer: A forward who drops into midfield instead of staying near center-backs, pulling defenders out of position and opening space for wingers or midfielders

test_cases.question: How does the Premier League relegation system work?
test_cases.expected_answer: Bottom three clubs are relegated to Championship, replaced by top two Championship clubs and playoff winner

test_cases.question: How many teams qualify for Champions League from Premier League?
test_cases.expected_answer: Typically top four teams

test_cases.question: Compare gegenpressing to traditional defending
test_cases.expected_answer: Gegenpressing involves immediate pressing after losing possession to win ball back in dangerous areas, unlike traditional defending which focuses on dropping back and organizing

test_cases.question: What are the differences between low block and high pressing tactics?
test_cases.expected_answer: Low block sits deep near own penalty area to deny space and counter-attacks quickly. High pressing involves applying pressure high up the pitch to win ball back quickly

test_cases.question: How do heatmaps help in football analytics?
test_cases.expected_answer: Visualize where players spend time on pitch, reveal positional roles like inverted full-backs or roaming playmakers, help identify weaknesses

test_cases.question: What is the purpose of wearables and GPS tracking in football?
test_cases.expected_answer: Collect data on distance covered, sprint counts, high-intensity efforts to manage fatigue, reduce injury risk, and individualize training

test_cases.question: What makes Arsenal's 2003-04 season special?
test_cases.expected_answer: They went unbeaten the entire season with 26 wins and 12 draws, earning the nickname 'The Invincibles'

test_cases.question: Who manages teams that use high pressing tactics?
test_cases.expected_answer: Jürgen Klopp is famous for gegenpressing and high-press tactics

test_cases.question: What role do inverted full-backs play?
test_cases.expected_answer: They tuck into central midfield when team has possession, creating numerical superiority in midfield while wingers stay wide

test_cases.question: Why is home advantage important in Premier League?
test_cases.expected_answer: Loud intense atmospheres with tens of thousands of supporters create psychological effect that can intimidate visiting players and boost home team performance

test_cases.question: What is VAR and when was it introduced?
test_cases.expected_answer: Video Assistant Referee, introduced in 2019-20 season to review critical decisions like goals, penalties, red cards

test_cases.question: Who holds the Premier League single-season goal scoring record?
test_cases.expected_answer: Erling Haaland with 36 goals in 2022-23

test_cases.question: What is Manchester United's treble achievement?
test_cases.expected_answer: Won Premier League, FA Cup, and Champions League in 1998-99 season with dramatic comeback in Champions League final

test_cases.question: What do progressive passing metrics measure?
test_cases.expected_answer: Track passes that move ball significantly closer to opponent's goal (typically 10+ yards forward), identifying players who advance play and break defensive lines

test_cases.question: What makes away supporters important in Premier League culture?
test_cases.expected_answer: Their passionate traveling support, journeying hundreds of miles, creating incredible atmospheres even in hostile stadiums, considered backbone of English football culture
